intro: Roupala sororopana, commonly known as the New Zealand punga, is a small evergreen tree native to New Zealand. It belongs to the family Proteaceae and is characterized by its dense, rounded crown and dark green, glossy leaves. The plant produces small, white, fragrant flowers that bloom in spring, followed by woody pods containing several seeds. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in coastal and lowland forest areas. Due to its ornamental value and ecological importance, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens and conservation areas.
